QuestionStem: Complete the statement to describe the prickly pear cactus.

options.PreQuestion: Prickly pear cacti live in hot, dry habitats. The spines are modified leaves that do not have stomata. The green stems of the cactus store water and are covered in stomata. The site of photosynthesis in the prickly pear is likely to be the

CorrectFeedback: Photosynthesis takes place in the stems of many cacti. They exchange gases with the environment through the stomata on the stem surface.
PartiallyCorrectFeedback: How would a plant get rid of excess water?
IncorrectFeedback: How would a plant get rid of excess water?
FinalIncorrectFeedback: Photosynthesis takes place in the stems of many cacti. They exchange gases with the environment through the stomata on the stem surface.
